channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What to Know About the Assassination Attempt on Trump
item.description: The former president was holding a rally when he said he was shot in his ear. Two people, including the suspected gunman, were killed and two were critically injured.

item.title: How China Rebuilt a Cambodian Naval Base
item.description: Before and after satellite images show how China transformed one Cambodian navy base.

item.title: Did social media really fuel the youth mental health crisis? ‘The Anxious Generation’ researcher calls the correlation ‘irrefutable’
item.description: 'The Anxious Generation' chief researcher holds his ground in what he calls “a normal academic debate.”

item.title: After Such Violence, the Center Must Hold
item.description: There has rarely been a better time to love our enemies.

item.title: From Exile in London, a Crime Novelist Works to Transform Russia
item.description: Boris Akunin, the creator of a hugely popular detective series, hopes that fomenting a vibrant Russian culture abroad might undermine President Vladimir V. Putin’s government at home.

item.title: Trump injured but ‘fine’ after assassination attempt; FBI identifies gunman as 20-year-old Pennsylvania man
item.description: The FBI early Sunday named Thomas Matthew Crooks, 20, of Bethel Park, Pennsylvania, as the subject involved in the assassination attempt.

item.title: Alec Baldwin Still Faces ‘Rust’ Lawsuits After Trial Is Dismissed
item.description: The possibility of a manslaughter conviction is over, but Mr. Baldwin has been accused of negligence in lawsuits related to the fatal shooting of the movie’s cinematographer.

item.title: Are Games Like the Euro 2024 Final the Riskiest Gig in Music?
item.description: Performing before a major match like the Euro 2024 final offers priceless visibility, and the nonzero chance that you’ll be booed.

item.title: Bitcoin rises as Trump shooting seen increasing re-election odds
item.description: Bitcoin rose as much as 2.1% to $59,849.84, before paring that advance to trade at about $59,426 as of 10:25 p.m., New York time.

item.title: No Contact America
item.description: Encouraged on social media, many Americans are estranging themselves from their families as a therapeutic step.

item.title: In England, a Changed Nation Hopes for a Change in Soccer Fortunes
item.description: After installing a Labour government for the first time in 14 years, the country is looking to a historical precedent as a presage to a long-awaited sporting success.

item.title: Trump assassination attempt makes election win more likely, and Americans’ willingness to use political violence may be highest since the Civil War, Ian Bremmer says
item.description: "This is the worst sort of event that can happen in that environment, and I deeply worry that this presages much more political violence and social instability to come."

item.title: Migrants Find Joy and a Taste of Home in a Manhattan Church Kitchen
item.description: At a volunteer-run center, migrants come together across cultures and religions to share flavors from their homelands amid a polarizing crisis. But funding is running low.

item.title: Big Indian Weddings Highlight Economic Divide
item.description: Henna artists’ elaborate designs are a hallmark of Indian weddings. They also highlight a disparity where some are fabulously rich and many earn very little.

item.title: Biden says ‘everybody must condemn’ attack on Trump as campaign halts messaging to supporters and pulls TV ads
item.description: “We cannot allow this to be happening,” Biden said. “The idea that there’s violence in America like this is just unheard of."
